website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you're looking for a way to use 2 hole saws on the same arbor to fix a hole that has been drilled too small.
pros: Can use it to enlarge holes that have been drilled too small
For use as a replacement on any Starrett A1, A2, or A10 type arbors
cons: Some felt that this option was smaller and less robust than they expected

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for making holes wider
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for making holes wider except must use one smaller with one bigger. If you are trying to widen one size above the smaller hole you may have a problem because the smaller holes use a smaller adapter than bigger. As long as you use the different adapter size you'll be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Deano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for enlarging holes
customer_reviews.text: Needed to make a larger hole for the lock in our metal entry door. My set of hole saws couldn't accommodate the two needed. This made it super easy. Not sure if I'll ever need it again, but kind of hope I will.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric

customer_reviews.title: It’s the only way to go
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have one you need to get one. Best tool for enlarging through hull fitting on boats
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and an inexpensive alternative
customer_reviews.text: Really helped with enlarging older door holes to fit new standard lock sizes. Much better than buying the notmal $85 retro-fit tool.
customer_reviews.author: JRidge28

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Functions well and is a simple solution to a frustrating problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Vandervoort

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: It was useful to help cut a larger hole than what was already in the door.
customer_reviews.author: durango_ro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Enlarged several holes I had drilled too small. Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.author: LeftSeat

customer_reviews.title: Genius Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever created this piece of hardware deserves to have a street named after them! This is really the only reasonable solution to upgrading old, smaller deadbolt hardware!
customer_reviews.author: FlyingWeasel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little product...Worked great and as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little product...Worked great and as expected. Add it to your tool box. You will need it some day.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ramig

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great solution for expanding holes. Works great with my DeWalt hole saws.
customer_reviews.author: Jerod Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GREAT & useful hole saw accessory. Quality made and so useful for door-lock work.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Simple idea that works.
customer_reviews.text: The product does what it claims, you are able to use two hole saws on the same arbor to correct a hole that was drilled too small. It's a simple idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Murnane

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I works. I needed a 1 3/4 hole and there was a 7/8 hole already. I replaced my pilot bit with the Starrett KA19-N and used the 7/8 hole saw to guide the 1 3/4 hole saw. It works well. I do not use it everyday but when I need to drill a larger hole this is the way to go. With this I can do in field modifications and not have to go back to the shop to use the drill press when I need to make a 7/8 hole into a 1 3/4 hole.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Starrett KA19-N"Oops" Arbor, Hole Enlargement Arbor
product_meta.description: Starrett KA19-N "Oops" Arbor, Hole Enlargement Arbor. Replaces the pilot drill in any Starrett A1, A2 or A10 type arbors. Replacing the pilot drill, the KA19 allows diameters to be enlarged by attaching a saw of the same size to that of the existing hole. This saw then acts as the pilot for the larger diameter saw that is attached to the arbor in the normal way.
